channel.title: Hi, Npc drops!
channel.description: Hey i added a dark beast and added at npcsdrops.cfg wat he should drop..rarely..but when you kill him it drops nothing..What did i do wrong?

item.title: Hi, Npc drops!
item.dc:creator: @marioman marioman
item.description:
@marioman wrote:

search for
Code:
if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 50)
{
ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.dragonbones(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false);
ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomKBD(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false);
}its the drop of KBD,
Again doing it by quoting same reason as before.

Quote
if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 50)
is the ID of NPC,
well example,50 is ID Of KBD. and 3 is for man etc…

Quote
ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.dragonbones(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false);
ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomKBD(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false);
}
These mean the drops you want,
just Replace the dragonbones(); with your void
if you want random item drop open item2.java and
this is the table for it:

Code:
public static int YOURDROPNAME[] = {ITEMS_HERE};

public static int randomDROP_NAME()
{
	return YOURDROPNAME[(int)(Math.random()*YOURDROPNAME.length)];
}

IMPORTANT!!!This tut belongs to RSC[]Coder i did not make it and i am not taking any credit all credit goes to him) ;D
